title: Polynomial Functions - Rewriting and Solving - Part A

content.question: Part A The functions <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>h</mi> </math> are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48E5@</annotation> </semantics> </math> <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44A9@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (i) Find all values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> for which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (ii) Find all values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> for which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CFD@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text: Part A The functions <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>h</mi> </math> are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48E5@</annotation> </semantics> </math> <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44A9@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (i) Find all values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> for which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (ii) Find all values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> for which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CFD@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
